column2: Vivendi to buy U.S. debt after Activision disposal PARIS
column3: Oct 16 Vivendi said it would offer to buy up to $2.7 billion of its outstanding U.S. dollar-denominated debt after it received $8.2 billion in cash from the sale of most of its stake in videogame unit Activision Blizzard.

column2: CORRECTED-American Express profit rises 9.3 pctUPDATE 2-American Express profit rises as corporate spending picks up Oct 16 American Express Co posted a better-than-expected 9 percent rise in quarterly profit as spending by corporate card users began to pick up after more than a year of sluggish growth.  UPDATE 2-American Express profit rises as corporate spending picks up Oct 16 American Express Co posted a better-than-expected 9 percent rise in quarterly profit as spending by corporate card users began to pick up after more than a year of sluggish growth. Oct 16 American Express Co posted a 9.3 percent increase in quarterly profit as people spent more using the company's credit cards.UPDATE 2-American Express profit rises as corporate spending picks up Oct 16 American Express Co posted a better-than-expected 9 percent rise in quarterly profit as spending by corporate card users began to pick up after more than a year of sluggish growth.

column2: Head of world's Anglicans joins Instagram to push credit unions LONDON The Church of England's spiritual leader has joined the photo-sharing site Instagram used by celebrities to reach a wider audience but instead of posting "selfies" he is using the social network to champion credit unions for debt-laden families.
